perturbation.original_text: 4.1 The Company will pay the Professional a base fee of thirty-six thousand dollars ($36,000) per year (the "Base Fee") for Services performed during the Term. The Company shall pay the Base Fee in four (4) equal installments of nine thousand dollars ($9,000) each on March 15, June 15, September 15 and December 15 of each year during the Term commencing on January 15, 2000.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1 The Company will pay the Professional a base fee of thirty-six thousand dollars ($36,000) per year (the "Base Fee") for Services performed during the Term. The Company shall pay the Base Fee in one (1) installment of thirty-six thousand dollars ($36,000) each on December 31 of each year during the Term commencing on January 15, 2000.
perturbation.explanation: Delaying payment of the Base Fee to a single annual installment may create financial hardship, potentially violating laws related to timely compensation for services rendered. The original quarterly installments provide a more regular income stream, which may be legally expected depending on the nature and duration of the services.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of state wage and hour laws regarding timely payment of wages.
